column4: How do I stop daemons from executing at boot the right way? I have rtm.
if this is natty or later and the service has a script in /etc/init/ then you can: echo manual | sudo tee /etc/init/servicename.override; (replacing servicename with lightdm or ssh or whatever)
Thanks, I will take a look at this now.
Mind telling me what exactly that does? I see that it the word manual is piped into the file ssh.override, but how does that change anything?
upstart override files allow you to modify the start on and stop on conditions of a service without modifying its config
Gonna reboot and test, what parameters can the .overrides take? I can look it up, but figured I would ask anway.
is there any reason you can think of as to why this wouldn't have worked?
which version of ubuntu are you on?
not sure, I'll take a look
may have found the solution..rebooting I will let you know.
I was redirecting output to /etc/init.d instead of /etc/init -_-
ahh, that would do it, at least it is working now
yea, thanks for your help..it's always nice talking to someone who knows there *nix.
